alert.note: Alert for Hickory (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 20 at 6:03AM CDT until July 20 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Hickory. In west central Missouri, St. Clair. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 603 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Ricky Creek at NW 603 Road, Hogles Creek at County Road 86, Weaubleau Creek at 350 Road, Monegaw Creek at NW 1301 Road and Clear Creek at 430 Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hermitage, Appleton City, Osceola, Lowry City, Wheatland, Roscoe, Vista, Gerster, Monegaw Springs, Iconium, Johnson City, Harper, Tiffin, Taberville, Quincy and Truman Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
